titleStmt.title: A Collection of papers relating to the present juncture of affairs in England

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed and are to be sold by Richard Janeway ...,

notesStmt.note: First in a series of 12 collections issued in 1688-1689 under title: A collection of papers relating to the present juncture of affairs in England; and reissued in 1689 under title: A compleat collection of papers, in twelve parts, relating to the great revolutions in England and Scotland.
Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University Library.

The humble petition of seven bishops to His Majesty -- Articles recommended by the Archbishop of Canterbury -- Proposals of the Archbishop, with some other bishops to His Majesty -- Petition of the lords spiritual and temporal for calling a free Parliament : with His Majesty's gracious answer --Vindication of the aforesaid petition -- Extract of the States General, their resolution -- The Prince of Orange, his letter to the English army -- Account of a design to poison the Prince of Orange before he came out of Holland -- A relation of a strange meteor, representing a crown of light, seen in the air near the city of Orange -- Lord Delamere's speech to his tenants -- The Prince of Denmark's letter to the King -- The Lord Churchil's letter to the King --Princess Anne's letter to the Queen -- A memorial of the Protestants of England to the Prince and Princess of Orange -- Prince of Orange, his declaration of Novemb. 28, 1688 for Sherborn Castle.
